name: Holiday Inn Glasgow Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel offers all you would expect, but with no additional touches or comforts. Designed to offer a one night pre or post flight sleep that is what if offers.
reviews.title: Standard fare - nothing wrong nothing great

reviews.text: The room was a little small (or pokey) but of reasonable standard. The bathrooom could have done with some touch-up and re-tiling but was also OK. I would stay again, but there is little other choice in the area.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: On the plus side, the staff are excellent. Friendly, courteous and helpful. The bed was very comfortable, choice of pillows and room was clean. Satellite tv was a bonus. On the down side, the duvet was burst at the stitching, the shower screamed at me when someone in another room used the water, the toilet roll holder was placed so that you couldn't sit straight on as your arms/elbows were in the way, the security chain/lock on the door was missing and some of the hot breakfast items were cold,as were the plates to be used with them. For a basic night's stay, it's fine. You sleep well. I would stay again for the convenience aspect of it but I wouldn't pay for breakfast and I certainly wouldn't pay full price for a room.
reviews.title: Superb location and service

reviews.text: My flight to Canada was retimed to leave first thing in the morning and I didn't relish leaving home in Edinburgh in the middle of the night so I booked the night at this hotel. Literally opposite check-in with a friendly reception staff who suggested a 'special deal' if I was eating supper in the hotel. This turned out to be an excellent deal - £20 for two courses chosen from the regular menu plus two drinks. Single room with a comfortable double bed was excellent value and despite the location opposiute the terminal, there was no aircraft noise. Thoroughly recommended.
reviews.title: Ideal Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Ideal location for a restful overnight stay at Glasgow airport before an early morning flight.
reviews.title: Combine with carparking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 1 midweek night in late April, ahead of an early flight the following day. Reception process was fine, they assisted with directions for Airpark parking, who had a courtesy bus handy. The room was comfortable and well appointed for the price. We needed some travel vouchers for the continental leg of our journey, which Sandra on reception readily and cheerfully traced on the internet and printed this for us. She was still as cheerful and helpful with directions when we checked out the following morning - although it wasn't difficult - straight out of the door, across the zebra crossing and you're in the departures lounge!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Excellent Location, Helpful Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the experience was good. I would say that the receptionist Nicole or Nicola was the most disinterested receptionist I have came across on my travels. A smile and a bit of chat goes a long way. I would go back the hotel is in a brilliant location and extremely clean.
reviews.title: Remenber to Smile.

reviews.text: I Stayed over night at this hotel with my husband and I was pleasantly surprised. The night manager was very cheery and made us feel very welcome. Rooms were basic but very clean. We went down for breakfast early doors on the morning of our flight and the young girl Lauren that brought us into the restaurant was very pleasant. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely be staying here again. great value for money.
reviews.title: Staff were outstanding

reviews.text: Location excellent, easy access to the airport literally across the road.
reviews.title: Great for a stop before flying off

reviews.text: Parked our car , stayed the night and had parking at the hotel for the week. No hassle at all.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: An older property in need of updating. I am sure it was posh in 1980, but it is not longer posh. The rooms was not cleaned well at all. The rooms are TINY. But the location is wonderful, right across from the airport terminal...just wake up and walk across the street into the check in area!
reviews.title: ONLY good for the night before an early flight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overnight stay complicated by snow meant having to eat in the restaurant.The fish and chips were revolting and not that cheap at £12.95. My other half had a steak sandwich at £10,inedible.Drinks were also expensive ,small glass of not very nice house red wine £6.05 Breakfast was fine and the staff were friendly,and its very near the airport.
reviews.title: convenient for airport but don't try dinner!

reviews.text: I stayed one night in the hotel following the cancellation of my flight from Glasgow Airport. I personally found the hotel to be quite pleasant and the staff were overall friendly and helpful. Two staff in particular couldn't have been more courteous; Duncan at the reception desk and Pat who served at breakfast. This was a stressful time and the attitude of several of the staff made it more bearable. Many thanks.
reviews.title: Helpful staff and comfortable hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel on a joint accommodation and parking deal. (Cars parked off-site.)
reviews.title: Ideal for the night before your flight

reviews.text: On arrival, the hotel car park was very congested because a convention was being held.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable Hotel, Excellent Location for GLA Airport.

reviews.text: Metres from entrance to airport this was a bit of a surprise find. Fair pricing and lovely room and bathroom. In house bar and restaurant. Short shuttle bus trip to city centre. Makes it viable alternative to staying in Glasgow.Accommodating staff ( could leave bags in stre while I waited for flight).
reviews.title: Unexpectedly pleasant
Perfect airport hotel
reviews.text: I checked into this hotel the night before my early flight departing Glasgow. The room was clean and fresh and appeared to be recently upgraded. Despite being across the street from the airport, it was quiet. It was the best sleep I had during my 3 week stay in Scotland.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was only $9.95 and the food and service were great.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: Catching my flight in the morning was as easy as walking across the street.
reviews.title: Does what it says! Good Hotel

reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Make sure you get a voucher for your breakfast!!

reviews.text: the room we had was excellent with mini bar ( not touched ) safe and air conditioning and all the other amenities.
reviews.title: Overall very impressed

reviews.text: the hotel was spotless and the service excellent
reviews.title: Ultra close to airport!

reviews.text: dinner was very enjoyable but £18 for a £4 bottle of wine ? that tells the story of how expensive it is but, we were on holiday so what the heck......and they will get away with it because that will be the attitude of most guests.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: we will go back , but only when flying out the country .
reviews.title: Convenient location, clean hotel but..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked this hotel as an overnight stay prior to an early flight and as such we did not eat or drink in the hotel.
reviews.title: Functional good clean hotel

reviews.text: we found the check in to be very efficient, with the staff friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room was functional and clean - sufficent for our needs.
reviews.title: Shabby

reviews.text: We booked the hotel on the internet as a deal with parking for our car for the duration of our holiday and must advise that the internet DOES NOT mention that the car park is off site with a shuttle bus - 15 minutes away.
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.text: Our room was very clean and had been recently remodeled; the evening buffet was very good and the morning breakfast could not have been better. The location is unbelievably near to the airport.
reviews.title: No problems for me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We normally use the Holiday Inn Express but got an extremeley good deal so decided to stay here. Last stayed here five years ago and the room standards have remained.
reviews.title: VERY CONVENIENT - BUT

reviews.text: Booked a stay and park deal which was exremely cheap but it had its down sides.
reviews.title: It doesn't have to be this bad...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was booked on the internet with the hotel website but the confirmation gave no details of where the parking was. I called the hotel and received details. However when I arrived at the car park they said I should have received a voucher. They called the hotel and things were agreed. When I arrived at the hotel and checked in the receptionist gave me the parking voucher and said this is what you forgot!
reviews.title: OK for one night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simply, the hotel needs to be brighter with its instructions.
reviews.title: fundctional,comfortable,only if you have a special deal

reviews.text: This was not a huge problem and I thought the hotel was a convenient and comfortable place to stay before flying.
reviews.title: Dissapointing...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is the closest hotel for the airport and the rooms and OK. The trouble is is the parking. There is only a small car park and it is first come first serve so if it is full you need to pay at the NCP which if you pay this you might as well stay somewhere else. The premier inn has a bigger free car park so i prefer to stay there. But as a hotel it is ok.
reviews.title: Close to the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night, was very very handy for the airport we had an early flight so was perfect and well priced. We paid £59 for the night and this included 1 week's airport parking so it was very reasonable. The hotel is nice but it could have been more organised & cleaner. The first room we were given clearly hadnt been cleaned, the bed wasnt made & there were used tea bags on the table by the TV, ok it was a mistake and they gave us another room after an apology, but the next room although looked ok initially on closer inspection there was quite a lot of hair round the bath and on the bathroom floor which really put me off! Its a shame because it is a nice hotel and the bar/restaurant area is very pleasant but i think the standards of cleanliness need to be raised significantly! Dinner was very nice but quite pricey!
reviews.title: Not bad for the price

reviews.text: I booked a special rate at £56 a night, some time in advance. A day or two before I arrived, I checked Trip Advisor and was rather concerned at the poor reviews the hotel had received. Yes, the room (205) was small, but it was scrupulously clean, relatively recently refurbished and comfortable. I felt it was good value for the price. The curry I had for room service was OK, maybe a little pricey, but one expects to pay over the odds for at this kind of hotel. My Garden Salad with sirloin steak and chips in the bar the next day was perfectly acceptable. As an airport hotel, I felt it was fine, although it would have been good if the parking had been cheaper (£5 per night).
reviews.title: Good accommodation for the price

description: The Holiday Inn Glasgow Airport is the ideal Hotel for those on business or enjoying a holiday in Scotland. Holiday Inn Glasgow Airport is the closest hotel to Glasgow Airport and only 10 minutes from Glasgow City Centre where fabulous shopping and nightlife is in abundance, an ideal base for anyone enjoying a City Break or many of the City Key Attractions. Direct Motorway access provides quick and easy links to the major Tourist Attraction of Loch Lomond, The Trossachs, Stirling and Edinburgh. While the Golf Attractions of Troon & Ayrshire are also within easy reach. For guests who need Long Stay Car Parking, the Holiday Inn Glasgow Airport has superb Park Stay & Go Packages which include Great Value Secure Parking for upto 15 days. For the Corporate Business Traveller there is the added benefit of our Academy Meeting & Events Facility with a great range of services. Please select the Meetings & Business link at the top of this page for full details.
